column1: #Text=Least Desirable : The purchase of the Green
#Text=Lane landfill site without lengthy consultation or discussion with the entire City Council .
#Text=The City must start investigating proposals for alternative methods of waste management that could prove to be more sustainable such as incineration .
#Text=If you were elected as a " rookie " councillor , What would you bring to the table beyond the incumbent ?

#Text=I am forward with a fresh start and futuristic outlook , innovative with beyond the box ideas , and thinking , as a natural communicator with a multitude of experience dealing with a variety of stakeholders .

#Text=Coming to City Hall with no political baggage and such experience would position me well to become a consensus builder not just within council , but with both the federal and provincial levels of government .
#Text=Toronto has enormous potential that has not been tapped in to yet .

#Text=I would like to see Toronto become a world class city that embraces zero tolerance for urban decay , Safe communities that encourage residents to keep active , responsible development for our neighbourhood , and most of all , accountability to it 's taxpayers .
#Text=Describe the three most important issues in your campaign .
#Text=Get the budget under control ; achieve value for money in City Hall spending ; protect our neighbourhoods .
#Text=What one election issue do you feel is most relevant to your ward in this election ?
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=I am concerned that Toronto is falling far short of its potential due only to lack of committed responsible leadership .
#Text=Why do you want to represent this particular ward on council ?
#Text=Ward 26 has been my home all my adult life .
#Text=How are you currently involved in the community ?
#Text=Over the past several years I have served in many capacities of local , provincial , and national scope .
#Text=This involvement has ranged from consulting to the Canadian Council of Ministers of the Environment to coaching pee-wee hockey .
#Text=I always assumed it to be the best city in North America .
#Text=I feel it is starting to slip .
#Text=I want to get it back on track to where I think it belongs as the best city on this continent in which to to live , work , and raise a family .
#Text=Which council decision ( since the 2003 election ) do you feel the city/your ward should be most proud of , and which was least desirable ?
#Text=Outraged at secret vote to try to slip a pay raise past the voters .
#Text=Seriously disappointed at decision to commit $500M to buy a hole in the ground as another temporary solution to the issue of waste management .
